FuncDef:
The display cpu-defend statistics command displays information about the attack defense on a specified interface board, including the total number of packets, number of passed packets, and number of dropped packets. The statistics are displayed in categories.
The display cpu-defend spu-car statistics command displays CP-CAR statistics of specified protocol packets.
CLIs: display cpu-defend spu-car { icmp | tcp | udp | gre | bgp | default | total | bfd-down | cipher-sa-miss | fast-channel | ike-dpd | ike-total-car | ike-tunnel-car | ipsec-rekey | plain-sa-miss | pst | dslite-private-ipv4 | ip-option | mtu-exceed } statistics slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend car { user-defined-flow <flow-id> } statistics [ slot <slot-id> ]

display cpu-defend car protocol { 802.1ag | arp | bfd | bgp | bpdu | dhcp | dns-client | ftp-client | ftp-server | hwtacacs | icmp | igmp | isis | lacp | ldp | lspping | msdp | ntp | ospf | pim | portal | radius | rip | rsvp | snmp | ssh-client | ssh-server | telnet-client | telnet-server | tftp | vrrp | web | ipv4-fib-miss | ipv4-multicast-fib-miss | ipv4-ttl-expire | ipv6-ttl-expire | ipv6-fib-miss | ipv6-nd-miss | mpls-arp-miss | mpls-ttl-expire | arp-miss | lldp | syslog | bgpv6 | ospfv3 | ftpv6-server | ftpv6-client | tftpv6-client | icmpv6 | dnsv6 | pimv6 | sshv6-server | telnetv6-client | telnetv6-server | eapol | netstream | snmpv6 | dhcpv6 | ra | mld | rs | ns | na | web-auth-server | diameter | openflow | http-redirect-chasten | unicast-vrrp | soft-gre | traffic-behavior-log | icmp-broadcast-address-echo | pcep | vrrpv6 | radiusv6 | hwtacacsv6 | lsppingv6 | syslogv6 | web-auth-serverv6 } statistics [ slot <slot-id> ]
display cpu-defend car whitelist { bgp | ldp | ospf | radius | rsvp | isis } statistics [ slot <slot-id> ] ap-id <ap-id>
display cpu-defend car whitelist { bgp | ldp | ospf | radius | rsvp | isis } statistics [ slot <slot-id> ]
display cpu-defend { all | application-apperceive | tcpip-defend | urpf } statistics [ slot <slot-id> ]
display cpu-defend car whitelist-v6 [ bgpv6 | ospfv3 ] statistics [ slot <slot-id> ]
display cpu-defend total-packet statistics [ slot <slot-id> ]
display cpu-defend car { blacklist | whitelist } statistics [ slot <slot-id> ] ap-id <ap-id>
display cpu-defend car index <index> statistics [ slot <slot-id> ] ap-id <ap-id>

display cpu-defend car protocol { 802.1ag | arp | bfd | bgp | bpdu | dhcp | dns-client | ftp-client | ftp-server | hwtacacs | icmp | igmp | isis | lacp | ldp | lspping | msdp | ntp | ospf | pim | portal | radius | rip | rsvp | snmp | ssh-client | ssh-server | telnet-client | telnet-server | tftp | vrrp | web | ipv4-fib-miss | ipv4-multicast-fib-miss | ipv4-ttl-expire | ipv6-ttl-expire | ipv6-fib-miss | ipv6-nd-miss | mpls-arp-miss | mpls-ttl-expire | arp-miss | lldp | syslog | bgpv6 | ospfv3 | ftpv6-server | ftpv6-client | tftpv6-client | icmpv6 | dnsv6 | pimv6 | sshv6-server | telnetv6-client | telnetv6-server | eapol | netstream | snmpv6 | dhcpv6 | ra | mld | rs | ns | na | web-auth-server | diameter | openflow | http-redirect-chasten | unicast-vrrp | soft-gre | traffic-behavior-log | icmp-broadcast-address-echo | mka | pcep | vrrpv6 | radiusv6 | hwtacacsv6 | lsppingv6 | syslogv6 | web-auth-serverv6 } statistics [ slot <slot-id> ] ap-id <ap-id>
display cpu-defend spu-car { cgn-icmp | cgn-icmpv6 | cgn-ipv4-other | cgn-ipv6-other | cgn-ipv6-raw | cgn-total } statistics slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend car index <index> statistics [ slot <slot-id> ]
display cpu-defend total-packet statistics [ slot <slot-id> ] ap-id <ap-id>
display cpu-defend car { fragment | tcpsyn } statistics [ slot <slot-id> ] ap-id <ap-id>
display cpu-defend car { fragment | tcpsyn } statistics [ slot <slot-id> ]
display cpu-defend car { user-defined-flow <flow-id> } statistics [ slot <slot-id> ] ap-id <ap-id>
display cpu-defend car whitelist-v6 [ bgpv6 | ospfv3 ] statistics [ slot <slot-id> ] ap-id <ap-id>
display cpu-defend car { blacklist | whitelist } statistics [ slot <slot-id> ]
display cpu-defend tcpip-defend-v6 statistics [ slot <slot-id> ]
display cpu-defend tcpip-defend-v6 statistics [ slot <slot-id> ] ap-id <ap-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates ICMP protocol packets.
-

Indicates TCP protocol packets.
-

Indicates UDP protocol packets.
-

Indicates GRE Keepalive packets.
-

Indicates BGP protocol packets.
-

Indicates protocol packets excluding the ICMP, TCP, UDP, GRE, and BGP packets.
-

Indicates the total bandwidth of packets to be sent to the CPU on a board.
-

Indicates the BFD DOWN protocol.
-

Indicates the CAR for the Cipher SA Miss messages.
-

Indicates the fast channel protocol.
-

Indicates the CAR for the IKE DPD messages.
-

Indicates the total CAR for the IKE protocol.
-

Indicates the tunnel CAR for the IKE protocol.
-

Indicates the CAR for the IPsec rekey messages.
-

Indicates the CAR for the Plain SA Miss messages.
-

Indicates the PST protocol.
-

Indicates the ds-lite private IPv4 protocol.
-

Indicates IP OPTION protocol packets.
-

Indicates MTU EXCEED protocol packets.
-

Specifies the slot ID.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Displays the statistics of the packets discarded through CAR.
-

Specifies the ID of the user-defined flow.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 64.

Specifies the whitelist.
-

Displays information about the attack defense on a specified interface board of a specified AP in a port extension scenario.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1024 to 8191.

Displays the statistics of the packets discarded through application layer association.
-

Displays the statistics of the packets discarded through defense against TCP/IP packet attacks.
-

Displays the statistics of the packets discarded through defense against URPF packet attacks.
-

Specifies a IPv6 whitelist.
-

Specifies the blacklist.
-

Specifies a protocol index.
The value is an integer ranging from 35 to 1658.

Indicates CGN ICMP protocol packets.
-

Indicates CGN ICMPv6 protocol packets.
-

Indicates CGN IPv4 other protocol packets.
-

Indicates CGN IPv6 other protocol packets.
-

Indicates CGN IPv6 RAW packets.
-

Indicates the total bandwidth of packets to be sent to the CPU on a CGN board.
-

Displays the statistics of the packets discarded through defense against TCP/IPv6 packet attacks.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> display cpu-defend spu-car icmp statistics slot 1
<HUAWEI> display cpu-defend car protocol bgp statistics slot 1
Configured CIR : 512       kbps       Actual CIR in NP : 512       kbps
Configured CBS : 1600000   bytes      Actual CBS in NP : 1600000   bytes
Priority : this index include more than one type of packet,
please use the diagnose command to query each of the packets' priority.
<HUAWEI> display cpu-defend car whitelist statistics slot 1
Configured CIR : 4000      kbps       Actual CIR in NP : 4001      kbps
Configured CBS : 600000    bytes      Actual CBS in NP : 600000    bytes
<HUAWEI> display cpu-defend car protocol web statistics slot 1
Configured CIR : 1000      kbps       Actual CIR in NP : 224972    kbps
Configured CBS : 1000      bytes      Actual CBS in NP : 225000    bytes
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To check the number of the dropped packets of each protocol to be sent to the CPU, run the display cpu-defend statistics command.
To check CP-CAR statistics of specified protocol packets, run the display cpu-defend spu-car statistics command.
Precautions
The display cpu-defend spu-car statistics command applies only to the VSUF.
